reviews.review_text: This is an Italian restaurant that I love We visited at lunchtime and ordered 3 kinds of menu and tiramisu All the dishes were perfect The pasta was especially delicious The three of us were moved after eating this pasta The house wine I drank at Happy Hour was really cheap, but it tasted luxurious and it was enough to make me happy lunch time We ate tiramisu here after eating, and we were even more impressed ngl This is seriously delicious!!! Im still drooling while writing this review. Im going to visit there again and eat tiramisu The server was very friendly and elegant, and the atmosphere of the store and the music was good It would be nice if I could visit here on Christmas evening

I went here for my friend s birthday and we throughly enjoyed it. The ambiance was cozy and homey, it was perfect for the winter. I really enjoyed that the food here was made to be shared like a family style dinner making it really enjoyable and memorable. Food here was great and the house wine, it really can t get any better especially with the price. Starting off with the Panzanella and Carpaccio with red wine was delightful. For the main we got the half Rosticciana and the Gnocchetti and ended off with a birthday Tiramisu. It was perfect portion for the three of us to share!

Had an amazing dinner at this Michelin Bib Gourmand restaurant in Vancouver. We said we wanted to get their $55 tasting menu and they picked a delicious selection from their menu to try. Everything was seriously great. I will return very soon to try their lunch menu, which features sandwiches using the amazing Pane Casalingo bread! 1) Arancini - well balanced risotto balls with delicate flavours topped off with a nice pesto sauce 2) Pane Casalingo - this bread is seriously amazing and why Im going to go back soon to try their lunch. They serve sandwiches with this bread at lunch! 3) Panzanella (missing from photos, too busy enjoying food) - nice fresh salad with a sweet sherry vinaigrette. I love the vanilla pickled strawberries they add in there. 4) Carpaccio - high quality beef with   ubriacato di vino  buffalo cheese 5) Rosticciana - braised ribs where the meat just falls off the bone with a gentle nudge. The smoked cherry glaze was so amazing I had to stop myself from licking the plate. 6) Ravioli al Nero di Seppia - squid ink ravioli with sweetcorn that pairs so nice with the lobster and prawns 7) Coccoli e Proscuitto - this is a ** MUST TRY **. Deep fried dough is very unique and paired with whipped stracchino cheese and 18 month Prosciutto di Parma makes it an incredibly delicious must try. 8) Gnocchetti - excellent texture on this Gnocchetti, which is a smaller gnocchi. The flavours are wonderful. I loved that there was a bit of spicy kick to it. 9) Torta allolio - I love the citrus from the orange balancing out the slight sweetness of the cake 10) Tiramisu - this Tiramisu is very nice. It has a darker espresso flavour, not acidic, which I really like and the cake overall is sweet, but definitely not overly sweet.

Went for dinner when a restaurant we wanted to go to had a LONG wait. So glad we ended up here! My younger daughter cant have dairy and we were pleasantly surprised she had enough options, plus our server let us know we could get the gnocchi with red sauce to avoid dairy. Whole family left happy and full! My husband wishes he could get the recipe for the cherry sauce they have for the ribs and my older daughter wishes we could get more of the ravioli!

Service was awesome, food was outstanding. We stopped in for something quick before a reservation somewhere else and we were happy we did! The staff were super accommodating, recommending what we could get in our half hour time frame. We had two cocktails and the carpaccio, it was the best I ve had in my life. The timing was great, the bartender serving us was super attentive, so at no point did we feel rushed. We love it so much we returned the next morning to try their sandwich menu. Fresh ingredients, chill vibe, and the verde nigroni was delicious. Thanks to the team for a lovely meal! Dietary restrictions: Thoughtful and accommodating to my allergy

Arancini with hazelnut pesto  that might ve been the best pesto I ve ever had. Beef tenderloin carpaccio with buffalo cheese and red wine mayonnaise was the top 2 carpaccios I ve had. Honestly I m not a huge fan of Italian relative to other cuisines; I was very very impressed by this experience. FYI octopus was good and not over cooked at all, but wasn t much different from any other restaurant that does octopus well.

Fiorino is a busy corner restaurant that has some great options. My wife has been there multiple times at lunch for their sandwiches and says theyre wonderful. Their dinner menu is completely different. Ive only been there for dinner and really liked their octopus. Drinks going to other people looked top-notch but I was driving, so I didnt partake.

My siblings and I were visiting Vancouver over a week ago and we decided to stop by Fiorino for lunch. There wasnt that many people in the place but that didnt deter us. The service was attentive, which I appreciated. After ordering, it did take some time to get our food. I happen to love mortadella so was pleased to see a sandwich with mortadello as its focus. This had to be one of the loveliest sandwiches Ive had in some time. The bread was thin and not overstuffed with fillings (which I like). The combination of flavors was delicious and the sandwich was enough to fill me up. We also ordered a caesar salad to share and it was remarkably fresh with a wonderful lemony dressing. I wished there was a place like this in US where I live. It really was a unuqie sandwich that I cant recall having anywhere else.

Im surprised it took me this long to try Fiorino. Great atmosphere and service. The dishes are a bit on the smaller side so I recommend ordering 4-5 dishes just to share and have variety. We got the Fritto Misto, Carpaccio, Coccoli and Prosciutto, and Ravioli al Nero di Seppia. Every dish was really delicious! Out of everything we got, the Fritto Misto (basically fried seafood + vegetables) was the most memorable. I have yet to have anything similar to this in Vancouver. I mean, yeah you can get calamari at a lot of restaurants nowadays, but the way they do it here.... *chefs kiss*. A definite must try if you come here! Will be back to try more items on the menu soon :-)
Great service, food and especially the Bistecca alla Florentina. It was outstanding. It came with roasted potatoes and an arugula salad. Finished the meal with some house made limoncello.

Not gonna lie, it s my first time in this restaurant and the food was very tasty but there were dishes in the google images that looked very delicious and were exclusive to  lunch time  so we couldn t try because we went to have dinner which from my point of view there wasn t much variety but my choice of food was very delicious 10/10! I need to come back and try your lunch menu.

Wonderful place to spend an evening. This is one of the better dining experiences I ve had in large part due to the server. He was warm, he allowed us time to make our choices and to visit, he was personable yet professional and just made the experience a happy one for our group. We opted for the regular menu instead of the Dine Out offerings so that three of us could share the food (it s meant to be served family style). The food came out at a good pace, everything we ordered was tasty and well executed. The space itself is vibrant, casual, welcoming. It felt nice to be in a restaurant where tables weren t packed in close together. An overall great dinner experience.
We eat at a lot of Italian restaurants and let me tell you wow, the pasta is cooked perfectly. The sandwiches have their own unique tastes and are delightful. Would recommend to anyone Food : 5/5

Adding a couple of pictures from my most recent visit. Highly recommend Tonys Espresso Martini  Food was great, went during happy hour with Arancini being one of the highlights. Really enjoyed our family meal at Fiorino. Team was kind enough to squeeze us in the end of the lunch menu. Lamb meatballs with an amazing salsa verde, saffron potatoes with a garlic aioli (cant go wrong with that). The panzanella salad was really well received by the younger family members as well as the adults (simple, colourful, and refreshing). Orecchiette al ragu di cinghiale was an amazing combination and everyone loved it. If there was any criticism it would be the tirammisu (good but not great, was missing stronger coffee notes). Will be back for sure :) - Too hungry for food photos... next time

I had such an amazing dinner here. We had a larger party of 13 and was anxious I couldnt find a restaurant to fit us.  I contacted Fiorino and they were so helpful and answered all my questions prior to taking our reservation.  Our server that night was so helpful in helping us curate our meal, based on our tastes and budget.  What a spread!  We samples 8 dishes at such a reasonable price point. I could not even sample the last two dishes I was so stuffed!  I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who is looking for a beautiful cozy venue with delicious Italian food.

Second time here and loved it both times! The Schiacciata Sandwich is (mini ones only during happy hour- pictured here) is bloody brilliant! That house made focaccia is the perfect vessel to house all the delectable meats and cheeses. Really did remind me of Venice and sitting on the bridge and watching the people pass by. The panzanella salad was delicious with all the bright cherry tomatoes and pickled grapes (I think). The arancini was divine with the mushrooms and balsamic reduction with a great crunch on the exterior. We will be back!
This is truly a 10/10 spot for date night. Very impressed with the service. Great wine list. Thoughtful menu with solid flavours. Definitely coming back!

Best Arancini I ever had! Hands down! If you are craving for Italian food  this is where you wanna be at. Perfect for Anniversaries, birthdays and hey if you wanna dine solo, this is the best stop! The staff is amazing and engaging. Service is fast and on point. The most surreal experience in budget!   Compliments to the chef!        cibo orgasmico, stomaco e cuore entrambi soddisfatti Gnocchetti is also impeccable! You cannot go wrong when you order here!
One of my favorite Italian resturant in Vancouver, Downtown. Love the vibe Love the food Reservation is a must. Food : 5/5 |

Bright orange umbrellas and white table cloths attracted my attention to Fiorino. A quick check on Google tells me they offer Italian Street food. Although we are mostly off gluten, the idea of sitting outside on generous sized tables with white table cloths, on the artificial grass (no bugs) platform, and on proper chairs (vs stiff metal chairs) has a strong appeal. So, I informed and waited for my partner to join me. While waiting, the Coccoli e Prosciutto caught my eyes. The server explained that the big donuts are deep fried dough (oooh). Gluten free or not, we are having some. We also ordered Gnocchetti (might as well!) and Panzanella. The Coccoli was additive. They are super chewy   made from Artisan Italian sponge bread dough deep fried. The manager presented the dish and explained that the 18 month prosciutto di Parma will be the best prosciutto we ever tasted   yeah right! One look a the thickly cut prosciutto tells me that they are likely going to be very chewy. But I was wrong and the manager was right. Although the prosciutto was thickly cut, they melted in my mouth, and they were not too salty either. Wow! We are lactose intolerant, so the whipped stracchino cheese didnt sound that appealing on the menu. But the combination was absolutely delightful. Because of this menu item alone, this wont be the last time we enjoy a dinner at Fiorino. The Gnocchetti with boar ragu was also very delicious. Lastly, the Tuscan style vegetable salad proved to be the perfect match for what we ordered. At first, I was hoping to get grilled vegetables, but the Panzanella consisted mostly of raw cucumbers, a variety of tomatoes, strawberries in a sweet dressing. Very refreshing on a hot summer evening, but also cooling for the fried dough and gnocchetti. Perhaps we will come back with another couple to try the 45 day dry aged porter house steak for four! We returned for lunch, the place was a bit different. After taking our order for sandwiches, they ran out of zucchini and came back to ask if it was OK to substitute mushrooms. The mushroom sandwich was quite good. I found the prosciutto sandwich a bit too thin and on the dry side   I would have preferred more greens.

Ive been here twice. I love the interior design.  The floor tiles make me feel like home. The food is tasty, but its a bit pricey. Service is good and the atmosphere is nice. It is a place I can recommend and come back to.

really lovely experience. service was top notch and food was pretty tasty- seemed to get better as the meal went on. the tuscan ribs were divine and the gnochetti was another top dish. the prosciutto, whipped cheese and dough balls was really good and the dough balls were just like my nonna makes them. will be back.

DINE OUT VANCOUVER 2023 Fiorino offers a 3-course dinner menu for $45. We tried both appetizers. My favourite was the tomato soup. The salad was good too but the portion was big for an appetizer. For the main course we got the Pappardelle al ragu di cinghiale and Seppie in Inzimino. Both of them were super delicious. And finally for the dessert we got the tiramisu and it was really yummy. The service was really good. I asked for drinks recommendations and our server recommended the Amalfi. It was delicious and boozy haha Overall, we had an amazing experience. We ll be back for more!

arancini 9/10 loved this, the sauce was amazing and the inside was so tender. carpaccio 8/10 yum. this was so good as well. the pine nuts was a great touch. agnolotti 9.5/10 oh my god delicious. the ricotta was so sweet and really helped get the salty gnocchetti down. the flavours were so good and I could eat a whole bowl by myself. gnocchetti 6/10 this was so incredibly salty I think they made a mistake when adding the salt perhaps? but when mixed with the other pasta, it was fine. tender lil gnochs, great texture. but needed a lot of water to get it down. didnt wanna bother the staff to remake it cause its still edible tbh service good, but I wish they left the water jug at the table because the sodium was giving me dry mouth ambiance slightly loud but thats the italian street vibe, cute interior. love the seating outside

The food was absolutely delicious (desserts might be been better than dinner), the staff was friendly and the service was super fast! A great family-style meal and will definitely be back. Parking: Pay parking parkade across the street.

Wow! This was a totally unsuspecting bombshell of a place. I think I enjoyed some of the tastiest dishes of 2023 here. Best ribs Ive ever had, by far, and gnocchi that blew the roof of my mouth off. The atmosphere was nice was nice and intimate, with great service to boot. HIGHLY recommend!

The food here was amazing! We shared the burrata and prosciutto, truffle pasta, gnochetti and the ribs and I can honestly say everything was top notch. Best meal we ve had in a very long time. Can t wait to come back and try some more!

Great little funky European style restaurant at the fringe of Chinatown. What i liked: 1) creative appies: they served me a small snack not on the menu (warmed focaccia bread and warmed green olives in with balsamic oil and vinegar). Nice touch! 2) large portion: The sandwich we ordered was a large portion (unfortunately no sides) and another fish my friend ordered fir Harte was a decent side dish. 3) happy hour: it s all day until 6! The longest happy hour I ve seen so far 4) wine price: their house wine is $1 per ounce! Location is great. Ambiance is unique. Prices are reasonable and the service was pretty awesome..

We had the best service with Jamie as our server! The restaurant is beautiful, food/drink/service 5  , and overall great atmosphere + service. Happy hour was SO good too! Highly recommend this Italian spot!

Recommend coming for a date night or a group or friends because the plates are designed for sharing! Beautiful space with beautiful food that tastes like it was cooked with love. The octopus was so tender and the pistachio sauce was very unique. I love the handmade freshness of the gnocchi too. We also tried the beef carpaccio which was great--lots of truffle flavour. Definitely want to come back to try the arancini and lamb meatballs.

We loved our first dining experience here, and will definitely be back! Everything was so fresh, tasty and of fantastic quality. Our server, a friendly guy from Florence, was so helpful and attentive! Cheers!

The food was phenomenal, one of the best carpaccio in the city.. The gnocchi was so deep in flavor and like eating soft pillows covered in garlic and meat.. We also had the ribs which were so soft that you could barely pick it up without it falling apart.. The tuna was good, but the only dish I wouldnt reorder.(my wife loved the sourness of the mango sauce). This is a hit restaurant, and everyone should try it. The service was quite slow, otherwise they were very pleasant.

Dropped by after dinner at one of the near by restaurants for dessert and drinks.  Would definitely come back and try their menu.  Everything we ordered was amazing.  Drinks and dessert.   The staff is very friendly and just a great chill, hangout to enjoy your meal or drinks with your friends.

On my eastside art crawl I came along this gem and decided to replenish my energy. I grabbed the mushroom pasta. If I attempted to spell the actual name I would be insulting Italy so best not get on there bad side. Pasta was amazing to say the least and the vibe inside was very comforting. Worth checking out

Highly recommend the dinner! Owner and staff are so friendly and definitely have the neighborhood Italian spot vibe! They got some unique dishes that I haven t seen in other spots yet. Recommend the happy hour too!

Current Review: Came back after several weeks and had an absolutely outstanding experience. Our food was phenomenal and the service was excellent. Gio, one of the owners, was brilliant and he made the night very special with added enhancements and touches to the service. The Wild Boar Gnocchi was exceptional and definitely the highlight. Highly recommended, especially if you enjoy rustic and authentic Italian street food. Initial Review: Came here on opening night. Overall, the experience was positive. Anything mentioned here is meant as constructive as I know opening nights are often used to iron out the kinks, etc. Service was friendly, but a little bit shaky. A couple minor things like having to ask for more water, utensils, etc. Nothing concerning, but the service could use some refinement. The menu was appealing and we ordered most of what was on it. All-in-all, there were some items that were beyond spectacular and some that were definitely underwhelming. Ultimately, the gnocchi and the tiramisu were and are home runs. The meatballs were over cooked and the sauce was slightly bitter and not that desirable. Unfortunately, we found a piece of metal in one of our dishes (although I often don t fault the restaurant necessarily for this). The ambience was phenomenal and it s a cool room. Definitely worth a visit. I m absolutely positive that they ll refine a few things on the menu and with the service and it ll get up to a five star rated. Make sure you give them a try. Our experience last night was positive, although there is room for improvement with the food and service, especially the food.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hello Nicholas, Thank you for your feedback. Can you please send us an email so we can discuss your experience further fiorinoitalianstreetfood@gmail.com All the best

reviews.review_text: Really enjoyed the atmosphere, service and food! We tried the carpaccio, the coccoli and prosciutto, the gnocchi, the polpo (octopus) and tiramisu. Our favourite was the octopus - it was cooked to perfection! Not to mention, the drinks were so good as well. The owners were so welcoming and the service was very pleasant as well. This restaurant is going to become a local gem. Definitely recommend trying this place!

Really enjoyed this place because it s not your typical over-portioned and over-cooked pasta/Italian joint. A good amount of variety on the menu. Loved the arancini balls, and I appreciated the thought that was put into the dishes. Nice atmosphere and felt as if I was in Europe. Would recommend!

Ciao frens!    Want to experience authentic Aperitivo experience in Vancouver? Head right to @fiorino_isf and they got you! - drool worthy sandwich goals   we loved how the mushroom  , fontina cheese   and truffle aioli complemented each other! Every bite was full of flavour - a light and sweet summery salad! Definitely a must try if you like strawberries! - mmmm we which we could ve had another slice! this dessert just hits different after any meal! Shibe eats rate: 9.53/10

A beautifully done space to make you feel like you may have been transported to a sidewalk cafe in Florence- but youre in Chinatown! Prices are reasonable & the menu, despite being small, offers a variety. I tried the lamb meatballs, insalata tricolore and the diavola sandwich on freshly made bread that was perfectly crunchy, savoury and delicious. Looking forward to trying the brunch!
Thoroughly enjoyed lunch here. If you catch happy hour $1/oz house wine, then I guarantee you will enjoy the relaxing atmosphere of this restaurant even more. I ll definitely be back.

Went here to get a sandwich with my fiance 6 months ago and I still think of the sandwich at least twice a week . Fresh, balanced, delicious. I really don t know what to say but I think it was the best sandwich I ve ever had in my entire life . I swear on my unborn children that I will never go to Chinatown and not stop at this place for a sandwich. I almost flipped a golf cart  in California a couple months ago because I started thinking of this sandwich and I completely forgot I was driving a small electric vehicle.

A diamond in the rough located in the sketchy Chinatown area. Fantastic Italian toasted schiacciata sandwiches.    Didnt do my beforehand research on Italian street meats/food items, the menu descriptions were like a foreign language to me, saw the word prosciutto and ordered it.  Also ordered the tomato soup and arugula salad. Soup bowl size smaller than what Im accustom to, cup size was the size of a teacup. Sandwich arrived nicely toasted and already cut in two since we decided to share one sandwich, plenty of prosciutto with arugula and mushrooms which softened the strong prosciutto flavor profile. Prosciutto was plentiful, moist and delicious. Gio very knowledgeable and quick to explain and answer any questions from the menu. Part II- dinner menu Ordered: Patate Arrosto Polpo Frito Misto Gnocchi Great vibe at night.  Bar busy serving cocktails, house white wine superb for the price. Potatoes appetizer was fluffy and moist with a nice thin crispy crust, perfectly cooked Gotta be the best Gnocchi i ever had, perfect match with the boar ragu. Octopus tenderly cooked paired with tasty pistachio sauce which didnt overwhelm the delicate taste of the octopus. Seafood was lightly battered and cooked to perfection to preserve the flavors of the seafood/vegetables (squid, shrimp, onions, peppers, etc) Top all this off with a flavorful serving of pistachio ice cream for dessert Both lunch & dinner very enjoyable, especially with Gios friendly knowledgeable menu explanations and his obvious passion shines through.

Delicious, Italian family style fare.  Fantastic fresh made pasta. We had Paparadelle with mushroom - it was delicious and beautifully presented.  Gnocchi with beef ragu was outstanding. Salads were tremendous.  Happy hour made the bill very reasonable with half priced wine wednesdays.  A great food experience.
Great atmosphere!  Gnocchetti was fluffy and just the right texture.  Fritos misto had a light batter so you could enjoy the seafood underneath. Friendly service!

Visited for the first time this week - highly recommend this place! Wine and cocktails were lovely and fair-priced. Beef carpaccio, frito misto, wild boar gnocchi and tiramisu were incredible. Super friendly and down-to-earth service. And the space is beautiful with great ambience - still bustling at 11pm. Had a great time and will definitely be back soon!

Amazing food and atmosphere. We ordered amny dishes for a birthday party. Every single item that kept coming to the table were all delicious. The staff were fantastic and friendly. Highly recommended and will come back again.

Stumbled upon Fiorino by accident while looking for a lunch spot in the area and am so happy I did! The service was phenomenal, the food is super high quality, and the restaurant itself is gorgeous too. Didn t get to try much food, but definitely recommend the spaghettoni ai frutti di mare!

Stellar lunch stop! Fresh bread, that s baked in-house makes a delicious and unique Italian sandwich! The $1/oz wine special during the day makes for an easy decision. I stop in here every time I m in YVR.

My family and I had a great experience tonight at Fiorino! The gnocchi, carpaccio, and tiramisu in particular were incredible, but everything was good. Service was friendly and attentive. The interior is well-designed. Highly recommend

Nice spot for Italian street food. We came here for the aperitivo or happy hour and I appreciated the vibe of the place and the friendly service (it was our server s first day too). We had the Negroni Classico, Aperol Spritz, Schiacciata Sliders, Crostini Misti and Polpette d Agnello. Everything was good   highly recommend the Sliders and Crostini. Will be back for dinner and appreciate having this option in the Chinatown area.

The team at Fiorino knocks it out of the park every single time with amazing food and an even better service. They try to add a few different items on the menu every once in a while as well which makes it more exciting to back and try a new dish.

We ordered the Chef s tasting menu. Simply can t go wrong. From the moment we entered to when we left the service was excellent. The wine expert was so knowledgeable and helped pick the perfect wine in our budget. Chef Joshua - wow! Each bite was SO good   excellent flavours and some very authentic Italian food. Couldn t have had another bite so for the value definitely a 10/10. The pace was perfect as well. Highly recommend, and already rebooked!
Amazing flavorful food, sauces are out of this world. We ordered: olives, bruschettas, octopus (pistachio sauce!!) and ribs. We enjoyed every piece of our food.

This is an incredible place! The osso bucco was a great main, the other notable dished were, the beef carpaccio, ravioli, octopus, aranchini, and a great finish of gelato, mint and cherry were amazing. Service was friendly and perfectly timed. The way that they organized the dishes was masterful.
The dishes are very fresh and delicious.Tiramisu from their family is highly recommended.

Dont get fooled by the Italian Street food! The food is simply amazing, and its definitely worth it during happy hour. Plus the staff is really friendly, and willing to help you choose the best wine !

My mom and I really enjoyed the food and experience at Fiorinos! We felt at home and not rushed at all. The Insalata Caterina and Cipolle Ripiene were our fav dishes. Would like to go back to sample more of their dishes!
The food is amazing and the staff is very friendly. They were a bit short-staffed the day I visited, so the service was a bit slow. It s undoubtedly one of the best places in town!

Everything is made fresh daily and is delicious! We tried their kitchen set menu and the variety was incredible. Meat fell off the bones, the pesto was some of the best Ive ever tasted and the desserts were light and a great way to end the meal. We spoke to the owner and they recently made a trip back to Florence to learn how to make the authentic focaccia bread even better! It was my first time at Fiorino, but I will surely be back soon.

Second time I come to this place and the food doesnt dissapoint. They recently changed their menu so we had the Papardelle Ripiene, gnocchetti, osso bucco and the rosticciana. Everything was delicious but the highlights of the night was definitely the Papardelle, it is the best mushroom pasta I have ever had in my life. We finished the night with the Tiramisu and the Olive Oil Cake, amazing as well. Service was nice and very attentive :) cant wait to come back

This is my new favourite spot! First came here as part of  tasting plates  and it was great. Visited afterwards and loved the dishes. Ambiance is a relax but hipster type of vibe. It was fun trying some Italian cocktails as well   I still rave about the tiramisu to my friends hahaha.

We almost tried everything on the menu, unfortunately fried calamari and other sea food baskets wasn t tasty , seafood was very greasy and taste wasn t the freshest . Lamb was excellent and cooked to the perfection , polpo was absolutely amazing, they knew how to cook it. Well done chefs and the crew
Cozy environment with delicious food. The dine out menu was totally worth it. Recommend arancini, Squid steak and tiramisu. Note: the food portion is small.

This place is a blockbuster new Italian restaurant that you must try. Doesn t everyone love young people trying to make a go of a risky venture? I do. This place is owned by three hard working guys in their 20s. You can tell that every single part of the restaurant is well thought out and the food is excellent! It s a small menu but I actually like that. If you went over to your Italian grandmother s house, would she give you ten dessert options? No, she would offer you tiramisu but it would be fantastic. The plates are small but meant to be shared. Oh and they take American Express so it s great for a business meal. Highly recommended.
Delicious Italian food... the service was very good and all the staff are friendly. Highly recommended for anyone looking for authentic Italian food.

Came here for apps and drinks (cicchetti and apertivo), got the arancini, a few spritz, some wine, and carpaccio. The service was great, food and drinks were perfect, the vibe was chill. If I m back in the neighbourhood again I d stop by this little gem. Definitely a bib gourmand

I celebrated my 50th birthday party at Fiorino and I cannot say enough good things.  The food was amazing.  The service was fantastic.  Everything came out perfectly timed.  Gio & Mitch were a delight to deal with.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

Gio has a beautiful place here, in my mind it s truly something special. His attention to detail and passion for what he does is apparent from the moment you step in the door. I had the Diavola sandwich with side tomato soup and my friend tried the Michelangelo. Both of us were delighted with the presentation and fresh taste of the food. We left while already thinking what we would want to try next time we get a chance to swing by.

I like their Italian style interior and photos from different places all around Italy. All dishes we ordered were delicious. Polpo is my favorite! Also they have a perfectly tasting dessert Budino. Kind of caramel mousse with light taste of nuts, very soft and not so sweet. Wanna go back to try their lunch positions:)

Absolutely LOVED the food and experience that we had here! They are vegan / vegetarian friendly which is amazing! Me and my boyfriend had the Vegetarian Gnocchi, Verdura Fritta and Crostini Misti (we asked them to make it vegan so they gave us the mushrooms & tomato which was soooo good)! Our fave was the Gnocchi and we ll definitely come back for more!! Their service is also top-notch   we got to meet Mitchel and Mario and they both explained the menu and even the ingredients to us. Hands down to our new fave Italian restaurant in Vancouver!!

Had a lovely evening at Fiorino yesterday. Beautiful restaurant with great ambiance. Our server Bianca was really helpful, kind and attentive. The food and house wines were amazing as well. The gnocchi, lamb and arancini were so good! The least favourite item ordered was the polpo - but understandably it is probably an acquired taste, however the sauce it came with was really tasty. Would definitely come back here to try out the rest of the menu.

Excellent service and food! Our server Mitchell was wonderful. We ordered the spaghettoni ai frutti di mare, the dish was super flavourful and full of seafood. The ambiance is lovely as well. I definitely recommend Fiorino if youre in the area!
Stopped by this fantastic eatery  at 5 PM-great happy hour til 6pm! Four tables outside + lots inside! Food was fantastic and reasonable will definitely come back again felt like we were in    Italy!

It was a great experience dining at Fiorino. The staff is amazing, the food and the wine are also incredible, very warm, kind and pay attention to their customers! They also have a pretty chill patio! Definitely a place to come back again. I have found my new favorite spot in Vancouver. Thank you!

Unreal. Walked in, immediately treated with a smile. We had the arancini, panzanella, and gnocchetti and a few different drinks. Fantastic. I can say Ive never had a better gnocchi in my life, though I havent been to Italy yet.

Great addition to Chinatown, one of the best new restaurants Ive ate at in a while. The brasied ribs were fantastic! Cant wait to go back! Sat at the bar the bartender was delightful and very knowledgeable, all the staff were super friendly. Food was so good I only ended up taking photos of empty plates.
Happy hour bites are well priced and great quality! Will definitely be back to try the dinner menu and highly recommend!
Loved everything we ordered, especially the sandwiches, and the tiramisu was pure perfection

Came here for lunch on a busy afternoon for lunch. The consensus between my friend and I were to order all but two of the dishes on the happy hour menu anticipating smaller portions. We were equally as surprised and impressed when much larger than expected portions began coming out. Every bite encompassed a brilliant authentic Italian street food experience.
The food and service were excellent. We had the ribs that melted off the bones, the beef Carpaccio was great and the Tiramisu was the best I have ever had.

Enjoyed a birthday meal a couple of weeks ago.  Table of four.  We did have a reservation, but the table was not quite ready.  The host was pleasant and chatted with us about the menu, as it is family style. We ordered 2 entrees per person, which we found to be loads of food for our table.  The stand outs were the ribs with cherry glaze and the fried dough with prosciutto.  Delicious.  But everything we had was outstanding.  We ordered drinks and dessert and enjoyed the meal from beginning to end. Parking was not available on the street, so we used the parkade directly across the restaurant.  However, the door was locked upon our departure so we had to walk up the ramp. Our friends parked one street over (connected by an alleyway) and found the gate and the door to their parkade was locked.  They had to call the posted number to let them out.  It was only around 8:30pm.
I went to celebrate a friends birthday, the customer service was amazing, the cocktails were fabulous. The server was very attentive with us. A place I ll definitely go back

Had the most amazing experience today. Food and service was absolutely superb. The wild boar pasta was so delicious. Our server Jay was so friendly and attentive. He paired our wine perfectly with our dishes. If we lived in Vancouver we would definitely come back.

Went on an evening night out, and had the type of great food and service that reminds you why going out for a meal can be a fantastic experience. Lively atmosphere and enjoyed everything I ate. Had the following items which were all delicious: Coccoli e Prosciutto Gnocchetti Rosticciana Formaggi e Salumi Tiramisu

Incredible food and ambience. Went for dinner one night and returned for lunch the next afternoon. Dinner was fantastic. The sharing plate idea is unique and something my family enjoyed. We had sandwiches for lunch, which of course, were delicious. Next time Im in Vancouver I will be sure to make an effort to return!

Went here for my birthday couple weeks back and it honestly had such a cute homey and cozy vibe for a date night. From the initial approach, the server was really welcoming and made great suggestions to our dishes such as saving our sauce from another dish to use as a dip with an upcoming dish which was stellar, by the way. I asked him (I forgot his name!!) for a wine recommendation and it was one of the best red wines Ive ever had. From the start to the end, my partner and I loved Florino and we are definitely making a trip to come back here when they have a new menu out!
Delicious food and drinks. Cozy/intimate atmosphere   perfect for girls night, family dinner or date night really.
Very good food. Favourites were the Carpaccio and Arrancini. Popular spot so reservations are important.

Love the variety of food options here. As the name suggests, much of the food served here is street food, so youll want to be comfortable using your hands to devour your food. The dining style is a bit different and very family and large group friendly. All dishes are meant to be shared. I love this concept as it allows you to taste many different flavours throughout your meal. Have a hard time making up your mind on what to try? This place is for you. Just make sure to bring along several of your family members and friends. Otherwise youll have to roll out of the restaurant. Enjoy. Parking: Parkade across the street. Street parking is paid. Kid-friendliness: Our teenagers had plenty of choices to choose from, but if you have a picky teenager the food here may be a bit too creative for the fast food junkie  . If they are open to broaden their taste pallets, it is a great place for them.

Ive been wanting to visit since opening but never had the chance to! We dined here for a friends birthday and we were so happy that we got to chance to do so. I made a reservation for a larger group and the pre-visit communication was phenomenal. Both Mitchel & Gio were very accommodating  they were so quick with responding to my emails. The restaurant welcomes with you with such a warm and inviting space, even when we were sat in the middle of the restaurant! I was very pleased with the service, everybody was so genuine and helpful, which is sometimes not an easy feat for a large group. The food was amazing, there were so many options to choose from but the choices were still concise. My personal recommendations would be the Arancini, the Carpaccio, the Porterhouse Steak (preorder) and of course, the Tiramisu. There are so many more dishes I d love to try so I hope my friends and I can visit again soon!
Third time for dinner here and it s always a treat. great food and staff. love it. Food : 5/5
Amazing and cozy warm place!! Love the vibe and food! This will be my go to place now on. Thank you for being so friendly and lovely.
Love the lay out and the color so much. Remind me of Florance. The preferita sandwich is soo...good
Even the simplest item on the menu would be hard to get right at home. Delicious food and a mean cocktail.
WOW just WOW. Staff 10/10. Food 10/10. Cozy warm restaurant with staff that go above and beyond. Green Negroni is a must try.

Enjoy a great meal here last week for our wedding reception meal. The staff were so lovely and super accommodating to us and our 14 guests. There was so many different family style plates for us to all share. They were great at accomodating dinner guests with dietary restrictions. The octopus and the carpaccio were stand out dishes. Will definitely be back again.

Fiorino is the perfect location for a date night or birthday celebration! The service and all of the dishes we ordered were absolutely amazing. Must-try items on the menu: vegetarian gnocchi (I ve been to Italy 3 times, this was better than any gnocchi I had there), octopus and tiramisu. Perfect share plates! This gem has a new menu coming soon and I can t wait to go back. Cheers to their chef Josh and the whole team for a lovely meal.

Excellent Italian restaurant in Vancouver s Chinatown. Food is all exceptional with lots of great small to medium sized options for sharing. The overall vibe of the restaurant is very nice. Not too bougie but still of a high quality. On top of all that the service was exceptional.
Fresh food and delicious with good service and atmosphere
